resources.string: Choose which number is greater?
Choose which number is greater?\n The game continues until you score 20 points. (questions may be repeated).

Congratulations, level 1 is completed!\n Do you know that the number 7 is the happiest number? There are 7 days in a week, 7 continents, 7 musical notes, 7 colors of the rainbow, 7 days of Creation and much more?\n Also, the number 7 is often the favorite number of people all around the world.
Choose which Roman number is greater?
Choose which Roman number is greater?\n The game continues until you score 20 points. (questions may be repeated).
Congratulations, the level 2 is completed!\n Do you know that in Roman numbers there is no digit zero?
Which animal has more mass?
Which animal has more mass?\n The game continues until you score 20 points. (questions may be repeated).
Congratulations, the level 3 is completed!\n Large creature is not necessarily a predators, usually they are herbivores.
Choose edible.
Choose edible.\n The game continues until you score 20 points. (questions may be repeated).

Congratulations, the level 4 is completed!\n It is known that many crocodiles swallow stones. But isn\'t because they are edible for them, stones help crocodiles to dive under water quickly and help they stay at the bottom.
Which card is higher/stronger?
Which card is higher/stronger?\n The game continues until you score 20 points. (questions may be repeated).
Congratulations, the level 5 is completed!\n Do you know in some card games the strength of the cards is looped and the deuce hits the ace?
What is faster?
Which vehicle is faster?\n The game continues until you score 20 points. (questions may be repeated).
Congratulations, the level 6 is completed!\n You need learn to drive all of these vehicles and only bycicle and skate you don\'t need special driven license.
Which planet of Solar system is farther from the Sun?
Which planet of Solar system is farther from the Sun?\n The game continues until you score 20 points. (questions may be repeated).
Congratulations, the level 7 is completed!\n Do you the nines planet Pluto has been demoted into the category of planetoids, like Vesta, Cerera, Sedna etc.?
Which thing has more mass?
Which thing has more mass?\n The game continues until you score 20 points. (questions may be repeated).
Congratulations, the level 8 is completed!\n Do you know that in vacuum weights and brick will fall with the same acceleration?
Which clock has more time?
Which clock has more time?\n Consider period 0:00 - 12:00.\n The game continues until you score 20 points. (questions may be repeated).
Congratulations, the level 9 is completed!\n Do you know that even a broken clock twice a day shows the exact time? :)
Choose what floats?
Choose what floats?\n The game continues until you score 20 points. (questions may be repeated).
Congratulations, the level 10 is completed!\n Do you know that if an egg sinks - it is fresh, if it floats - not?.
Choose which number is greater?
Choose which number is greater?\n The game continues until you score 20 points. (questions may be repeated).
Congratulations, the level 11 is completed!\n Do you know that Roman numerals isn\'t in common use? It uses only on the dials of watches and for the centuries designation.
Choose fruit?
Choose fruit?\n The game continues until you score 20 points. (questions may be repeated).
Congratulations, the level 12 is completed!\n Do you know that a banana is called a fruit in supermarkets, although it is actually a berry.
Who is exist now?
Choose a creature that currently exists?\n The game continues until you score 20 points. (questions may be repeated).

Congratulations, the level 13 is completed!\n Water bear or tardigrades. A microscopic creature that can survive in the temperature range from +150 degrees Celsius to absolute zero, and is also able to live for more than 10 years without water.
Choose, what is louder?
Choose, what is louder?\n The game continues until you score 20 points. (questions may be repeated).
Congratulations, the level 14 is completed!\n If you go away from the noise source two times further, the noise level fall 4 times. L ~ 1/R2
Who lives longer?\n
Choose, who lives longer?\n The game continues until you score 20 points. (questions may be repeated).
Congratulations, level 15 passed!\n The only creature on Earth that has learned to live forever is the jellyfish Turritopsis dohrnii, which can rejuvenate an unlimited number of times!
What has more mass?\n
Choose, the object has more mass?\n The game continues until you score 20 points. (questions may be repeated).
Congratulations, level 16 passed!\n Do you know Charon is not a satellite of Pluto. They are a double planet because their common center of gravity is outside the surface of both objects.
Who is the predator?\n
Which of these creatures is predatory?\n The game continues until you score 20 points. (questions may be repeated).

Congratulations!
 You have completed this little game!
 We hope you've discovered something new for yourself, you liked the game and you will wait for the continuation!
 Put stars, write reviews :)
